p: Although the in vitro finding of this study suggests that the extracts from R. albersii and C. amplifolium are effective against the selected bacterial species, this may not necessarily be the same in in vivo studies, as seen in previous studies.[ 27 36] Therefore, more detailed in vitro studies, including determination of minimum inhibitory concentration and minimum bactericidal concentration, and in vivo investigation of these medicinal plants should be carried out.
